headline.main: URUGUAY TO PAY ON DEBTS; New Minister Completes Plans for Resumption of Service.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: There was an undertone of strength in the value of the dollar last week, measured by the French franc quotation. It reached a premium of .4 cent of its new gold parity on Saturday, the best in more than three weeks. The opening was irregular and at a...
docs.lead_paragraph: There was an undertone of strength in the value of the dollar last week, measured by the French franc quotation. It reached a premium of .4 cent of its new gold parity on Saturday, the best in more than three weeks. The opening was irregular and at a slight discount, but improvement was steady after Wednesday. Range a year ago was 86.66 84.07 cents.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MAY 12, 1934.

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, May 13. -- Premier Jose de la Riva Aguero resigned today because of the promulgation of the divorce law by the Assembly. He said he could not order the publication of a law "disapproved by my reason and execrated by my faith."
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, May 13. -- Premier Jose de la Riva Aguero resigned today because of the promulgation of the divorce law by the Assembly. He said he could not order the publication of a law "disapproved by my reason and execrated by my faith."
docs.abstract: Premier J de la Riva Aguero resigns because of law; chs reopen

headline.main: PREMIER OF PERU QUITS SUDDENLY; Resigns After Promulgation of Divorce Law, Which He 'Could Not Approve.' REST OF CABINET REMAINS Churches Reopen After 24-Hour Demonstration Against Measure Passed by Assembly.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 17. -- American powers in the neighborhood of the Chaco conflict hold they cannot enforce any embargo on arms against Bolivia and Paraguay. They point to international law and treaties as the reason. They say the only way to keep...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 17. -- American powers in the neighborhood of the Chaco conflict hold they cannot enforce any embargo on arms against Bolivia and Paraguay. They point to international law and treaties as the reason. They say the only way to keep arms from the belligerents lies in a cessation of exports by all nations.
docs.abstract: South Amer nations hold treaties bar to arms embargo

headline.main: TREATIES ARE BAR TO ARMS EMBARGO; South American Nations Say They Cannot Halt Traffic to Chaco War Area. HOLD EXPORTS MUST END But Leadership of Washington Would Be Welcomed if a Precedent Is to Be Set.

byline.original: By JOHN. W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, May 18. -- Despite the cooperation of the new civilian militia with the police, disorders today marked the promulgation of the new Constitution and the inauguration of Gabriel Terra as President of Uruguay's "third republic."
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, May 18. -- Despite the cooperation of the new civilian militia with the police, disorders today marked the promulgation of the new Constitution and the inauguration of Gabriel Terra as President of Uruguay's "third republic."

headline.main: URUGUAY LAUNCHES 'THIRD REPUBLIC'; Disorders Mark Inauguration of Terra Under New Constitution -- Amnesty Is Decreed.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, May 18. -- South America's two hardest-hit victims of the world depression, Chile and Uruguay, took steps this week to set their financial affairs in order.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, May 18. -- South America's two hardest-hit victims of the world depression, Chile and Uruguay, took steps this week to set their financial affairs in order.

headline.main: RECOVERY SPEEDED IN SOUTH AMERICA; Chile and Uruguay, Hardest Hit by Depression, Take Steps to Meet Foreign Debts. REFUNDING PLAN HAILED Chilean Scheme Differs From Former Financing Methods -- Continent's Exports Boom.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: RULINGS ON FOREIGN BONDS; Exchange Details Settlements in Colombian and Uruguayan Issues.

docs.snippet: A COMMISSION, appointed by the League of Nations in June of last year, has startled the world by an outspoken denunciation of the war waged By Bolivia and Paraguay for the control of the Chaco.
docs.lead_paragraph: A COMMISSION, appointed by the League of Nations in June of last year, has startled the world by an outspoken denunciation of the war waged By Bolivia and Paraguay for the control of the Chaco.

headline.main: WAR IN GRAN CHACO BALKS PEACEMAKERS; ZONE OF SOUTH AMERICAN WAR It Has Gone On for Five Years Despite the Many Efforts Made to Settle It
